choices: Goodbyes are said, the first group to head out is Group 1
Follow the Group of your choice
111.content:
"With strength of body and mind, you have all managed to overcome the various trials that were thrust upon you all, never loosing faith or succumbing to the dangers of those who wish you harm. You have all gathered her for a purpose. As you all know, Master Xehanort as his vessels have issued the challenge to face them in the Keyblade graveyard. However, the time is not yet right to strike at them, for we need more time to prepare and we need to think of a solution that will prevent the X-Blade from ever being forged again." the wise and experience Master Yen Sid spoke to the individuals gathered in front of him. Located in his tower which existed on an offshoot of the realm of light, it was very difficult to detect and would be safe from any would-be attackers.

"Thus, within this time-frame, myself and King Mickey have decided that it would be best to separate you all and guard the Seven Princess of Light." All present chattered among themselves, many agreeing that it would be the best option to go with.

"And now, I will list the individuals to go with the respective Princess of Heart. Group number one will consist of Sora and Namine. Your princess to guard will be Kairi." A boy with spiky brown hair, clad in a black outfit and a girl with shoulder length blonde hair a blue eyes walked up. Alongside them was a girl that looked nearly identical to the blonde, but with red hair and a pink dress. The three nodded with each other and returned back to their places. Continuing on, the robed man with his wizard hat continued to list the following groups:

Group 2: Aqua/Ventus guarding Cinderella
Group 3: Lea guarding Alice
Group 4: Riku/Xion guarding Snow white
Group 5: Mickey guarding Aurora
Group 6: Donald and Goofy guarding Belle
Group 7: Roxas guarding Jasmine

And with that, the preparations were set and each group was set to travel to their designated worlds.
111.title: Journey into Mystery

choices: Sora and crew draw up a plan for their stay in this world.
Heartless suddenly appear in Halloween Town Square!
One of the Xenahorts sets in motion a dreadful curse.
1111.content:
"Good luck everyone!" Sora exclaimed, waving exuberantly.

Kairi just chuckled while Namine gaped a bit at Sora's optimism.

A moment later, the three traveled through a portal crafted by Yen Sid and into their assigned world.

Stars swirled and the cosmos passed by in the blink of an eye. Once it was done, the trio found themselves in a dark world, but not one claimed by the Heartless or the new Organization. No, this world's darkness had a more friendly tone.

Sora grinned as recognition lit up his features. Dashing towards a nearby gate, he hollered out.

"Jack!"

The gate opened, revealing a town square and all manner of ghoulish creatures. Kairi and Namine both gaped a little at the bizarre citizens that made up this Halloween Town, one, a thin skeleton in a tuxedo, approached.

"Sora, how splendid to see you!"

"I'm sure you're aware why I'm here."

"Of course, of course, and your friends have been here since yesterday. They're waiting in my home. Follow me!"

Sora did so, nearly dragging Kairi and Namine after him.

Jack's home was quite large for the slim skeleton and easily fit the trio. Once up on Jack's bedroom, the three all smiled.

Squall, for his part, just nodded towards them. Tifa, on the other hand, embraced the three in a tight hug.

"It's been awhile, hasn't it?" the mighty brawler asked.

"Yeah, but I'm glad we're here now," Kairi said. Maybe, she thought to herself, these two could help me remember what Radiant Garden used to be like and my past there.
1111.title: Goodbyes are said, the first group to head out ...

choices: The meal is made, next are training conditions
Let's see how another group is doing
11111.content:
Their greetings finished, everyone followed the lanky Jack as he lead them to Dr. Finklestein's tower. Squall and Tifa were a bit on edge in staying in such a weird place, nothing in the Radiant Garden libraries ever described such a world. Just to be safe, Squall kept his hand on the gunblade strapped to his back. Kairi and Namine were calm, the former due to her immense trust in Sora and the later having access to Sora's memories in the past. The walk up the tower was rather quiet sans Jack blithering on about how with everyone around, he would get amazing inspiration for next year's Halloween.

"Hello Dr. Finklestein! I brought everyone!" shouted Jack as he slammed the door open, causing the handicapped doctor to spill some chemicals on his workspace. The mad doctor let out a shrill scream as the fumes burned his nostrils.

"Jack, what have I said about barging in here! Ah well no matter, a little hydrochloric acid never hurt anyone." Everyone headed inside the small laboratory room, careful to not touch anything that happened to be moving, or dead, or both. Clearing his voice, Sora stepped into the middle of the room and tried to recall exactly what Yen Sid and the King had told him earlier.

"Alright, since we're all together now, let's get down to business. Our main goal is to protect Kairi here until our preparations are done and stuff." said Sora, pointing towards the girl with red hair.

"And what we need to do in the meantime is to train Kairi and Namine so they'll be able to fight as well." Kairi nodded, ecstatic that she could finally help out her friends and stop being the 'damsel in distress' of the group. Namine however was a bit less excited, the prospect of fighting, due to her demure nature. However, if Kairi was up to it, then so was she.

"From what Yen Sid told me, me and Squall are gonna train Kairi, and TIfa will train Namine." Hearing her name, the woman with long brown hair piked her ears, looking towards the blonde, She had no idea what sort of weapon she used, but it wasn't a keyblade, otherwise she'd train with the others.

"Also, I have some other training partners too." said Sora as he focused a hand on his chest, causing his center to glow. A second later, three colorful animals appeared in the room. One was something that looked like a cat, or a dog or something in between. It was blue in color and had a little horn on top of its head. The next was a purple bat like creature that fluttered in the air, its eyes looking incredibly goofy. The last was a giant panda like creature, with sharp claws, a round belly and a cape worn around its neck. The group look in shock that Sora could summon such creatures. After his journey in the realm of sleep, he and Riku had manage to acquire a few new powers, including summoning these dream eaters from the other realm.

"These guys are called Dream Eaters. They're kinda like heartless, except they're all good and junk. They're called Meow Wow, Komory Bat and Kooma Panda." Let out a cute squeal, Kairi ran up to Meow Wow, scooped it up in her arms and cuddled with it.

"Oh Sora, they're all so cute!" she exclaimed as the creature began to like her face. The others had similar reactions, and petted the creatures as well.

"Astounding! According to books I've read, these creatures shouldn't even exist!" shouted the mad doctor as his craving for experimentation increased.

"Yeah, they're kinda weird like that. They're like made from rainbows and clouds and all sorts of good things." laughed Sora as Komory Bat landed on his head.

"So what are these guys for anyway?" asked Squall, not convinced of their usefulness just yet. Trying to think of a good way to show how these guys could be good for training.

"Tifa, how about you punch this guy in the stomach as hard as you can." Surprised at such request, she trusted Sora enough to know what he was doing. Walking up to the bear, she readied a fist and launched an explosive punch right into the dream eater's center. Kooma Panda simply absorbed the force and caused Tifa to be bounced back a few meters.

"Wow, I even gave it a serious charge too." said Tifa inspecting her fist.

"Yup, the only things that can hurt these guys are magic and Nightmares, but since Nightmares don't exist here, they're good. Oh I got one last guy to show you all." said Sora as he focused once more and another creature was summoned. This time it was a bipedal frog, orange in color wearing an apron, a chef's hat and help a skillet and top as makeshift weapons.

"This guy's name is Chef Kyroo. Since Halloween Town doesn't exactly have food that we can eat, no offense Jack, this guy can pick up materials from the Realm of Sleep and cook us up some nice meals." said Sora as he gently pet the proud creature.

"Oh, human cuisine! I've never had that before. I'm sure that the people here will find it spookishly fun!" shouted the Pumpkin King as he examined the small creature.

"So guys, howabout some grub before we get started?"
11111.title: Sweet Stuff

choices: After their meal, Sora remembers that they have to hide their hearts.
111112.content:
Aqua had been to many strange worlds in her duty as a Keyblade wielder, but the one she was currently in took the cake. No, it wasn't the fact that she had to shrink to use a door, it was the talking door-knob that really threw her for a loop. But she decided not to focus too much on the weirdness of Wonderland and just do her duty.

Ventus was beside himself with glee and Aqua had to reign him in a few times from joining in with the Mad Hatter's antics. Luckily all it took was a few stern glares.

Cinderella, for her part, marveled at everything but acted as kind and gracious as Aqua remembered her. She had been extremely pleased to see Aqua as her protector and the two would often spend their time together in their quarters, Cinderella filling Aqua in on the events that had transpired during her long stay in the realm of darkness.

The Queen of Hearts, persuaded by her husband and Yen Sid, allowed the trio to stay in her castle, the rooms given to them ornate and marvelous, though the wardrobe in Aqua's room did mention that she looked rather thin.

Currently, she was standing across from Cinderella and Ventus.

"Yen Sid gave me instructions to hide our hearts away from the enemy's spies and magic, but we'll need to gather a few ingredients around Wonderland first. Ventus, one of us will go do this while the other stays and guards Cinderella. Now which would you rather do?"
111112.title: Let's see how another group is doing

choices: The next day, follow Sora and Co
1111122.content:
The Chef Kyroo had managed to create everyone's meals to their likings. As dream materials tend to be fresher and more flavorful than their reality bound counterparts, its no surprise that some of the group went up for seconds. The group had retreated back to Jack's manor, the skeleton delighted to have such colorful guests over. He would have incredible fun when everyone was sleeping, after all, who didn't enjoy a nice spook every now and then? They were now in his living room, discussing how to approach their plan next.

"Alright, so there's one last thing that Yen Sid told me before we all left." said Sora, bringing the attention upon himself. Kairi and Namine were snacking on some seasalt ice cream that the small dream eater had managed to create for them, and the taste was simply out of this world.

"I don't really get it, but he gave me a list of ingredients. Since we need to hide Kairi's heart away without actually, y'know, taking it from her again, we need to use magic that will conceal her from Master Xehanort and his lame cronies." explained Sora. Squall and Tifa had already learned of the old keyblade master's plot and how he was personally responsible for the initial destruction of their homeworld. Clutching his fist, Squall began to feel anger, and regret that he was powerless to save Radiant Garden. Tifa noticed a shift in his expression, she would have to talk to him later on. Sora pulled out the scroll from his pouch and unraveled it, the parchment reaching to the floor.

"Wow, that's a little extreme don't you think?" said Jack as he leaned down to the very bottom of the list. Reading a few of the ingredients, he formed a frown on his normally jolly face.

"Hm, some of these might be a little hard to get I'm not afraid. I've never even seen a tongue-tied tongue before."

"Yeah that's what he told me too, which is why we need to talk to the people around here for help too. I have plenty of munny so it shouldn't be too hard to get the more stubborn ones to comply." said Sora as he recalled the small fortune he had amassed from his travels. Heartless, nobodies and dream eaters had so much money on them for some reason. Eventually they agreed that the next day, Sora, Squall and Kairi would look for the more easier obtained ingredients while Namine and Tifa remained. It was a good opportunity for Tifa to teach the basics to Namine as well.

"Um Sora, before we go to bed, can I have more ice cream?" said the red haired girl, finished with the pint of sea salt ice cream she had received.
1111122.title: A Hidden Heart

choices: By the end of the day all of the ingredients have been assembled.
11111221.content:
The Mayor of Halloweentown gasped as he read the list Sora gave him, his face flipping to his white, distressed mode.

"Oh, this is terrible!"

"What is it?" Sora asked.

"Tongue-fried tongue...I...I know where to get some but...but...oh ,this is terrible!"

"Mayor, we need your help," Jack pleaded.

"Well to get tongue-fried tongue you have to go to the clown with the tearaway face and get him to take you to the vampires' hidden crypt. From there you'll have to convince Lock, Shock, and Barrel to be on their best behavior and, finally, you'll need to get the ghosts to stop wailing and show you where they hid their tongue-fried tongues!"

"Um...no sweat, right guys?"

Squall shrugged his shoulders while Kairi nodded at Sora. Jack was rubbing his hand under his chin.

"That is quite the task for that one item, but I'm sure we'll succeed!" Jack exclaimed.

"Don't say I didn't warn you," the Mayor muttered before walking away.
11111221.title: The next day, follow Sora and Co

choices: The potion is complete and getting ready for bed
111112211.content:
It had taken nearly the entire day, but all of the ingredients were finally gathered. Everyone was resting up in Jack's spookishly comfortable living room. It had taken a barrel full of screaming mints, a devil's egg and the dignity of a few party members, but it was worth it in the end. All of the items were thrown on the table, some of the more peculiar items moving about very sluggishly.

"So now what Sora?" asked Kairi who was sitting on the couch right next to the brown haired teen. She wanted nothing more than to take a nice hot shower and sleep the night away. Perhaps a snack or two as well. Taking out another piece of paper from his many pockets, he unfolded the parchment and scanned it over. "Hm, it just says to put them all into a cauldron and use fire on it. Seems easy enough I guess."

"It is magic after all. Magic doesn't need to make sense, I think at least."

"Well whatever it is, let's just hurry up so we can move onto training. The sooner we help these girls out, the sooner we can leave this weird place." said Squall, resting on the recliner, a bit sore from the day's endeavors. Tifa nodded, figuring that he was itching to get some fighting done. In actuality, the things he had seen this day really weirded him out.

"If all you need is a cauldron, I've got plenty, especially ones with hauntingly amazing designs. Don't fret, I'll be back in two shakes of a batratcat's tail. Or was it three?" pondered the skeleton king, making his way down to his cellar. Namine smiled, she enjoyed it when everyone was lively, not to make a pun or the sort. Having a craving for that snack, Kairi latched on to Sora's arm, with a puppy dog expression on her cute face.

"Sora, while we wait, can you take out the froggy and have him make me something to eat?" A red tinge on his face, Sora needed to turn his head to the side since the red haired girl was invading his personal space.

"Y-Yeah, not a problem." In response the girl gave him a quick hug, causing him to let out an awkward laugh. Watching the scene, Namine was reminded of a certain someone who she missed, a certain blonde.

'Roxas, I hope you're doing well...'
111112211.title: By the end of the day all of the ingredients ha...

choices: It's Tifa and she's pigging out from Jack's fridge.
On another world, Yuffie's getting distracted by her growing stomach.
1111122111.content:
The potion had the consistency of two day old sludge and smelled even worse. Kairi and Namine blanched a bit looking at the churning mess while Sora just looked disgusted. Squall just sighed while Tifa looked determined.

Striding up towards the potion, she took a hearty portion of the stuff and drunk it down as fast as she could.

That done, she turned towards the others who were gaping at her.

"It doesn't taste that bad," Tifa replied.

Squall was next, downing his like a glass of whiskey followed by Sora. Kairi followed him and Namine was last.

"So...was that it?" Kairi asked.

"I guess so," Namine replied.

Suddenly, Sora let out a wide yawn, followed by yawns from the rest of the group, save Jack, Sally, and the Doctor.

"Feeling a bit drowsy...all of a sudden," Tifa murmured, heading towards her room.

The rest all nodded at her proclamation and soon enough the five of them were deep in slumber.

Four hours later, towards midnight, Squall woke up, hearing someone moving past his room.

Getting up to investigate, his eyes widened as he saw who it was.
1111122111.title: The potion is complete and getting ready for bed

11111221111.content:
Getting off his edge, Squall was relieved of his current tension. In the fashionable decorated kitchen of Jack's stood a rather strange but safe view. It was Tifa who was bent over, searching in the fridge and eating some of the food as well. While Halloweentown cuisine was out of the ordinary it was safe for regular human consumption. Still trying to understand the scene that played before him, he noticed her sleeping attire which was a rather long black shirt and large baggy cotton pants. If Squall was a man who was more in tune with his 'emotions' he would have called the girl cute in this situation. Another minute passed of him watching the woman scarf down some leftover dishes and he decided he should at least ask her if she was okay, this seemed to be highly out of character after all.

"Hey Tifa, is everything alright?" Placing a firm hand on her unsuspecting shoulder, Tifa jumped back in shock, causing Squall to be pushed back a few inches by her rear, which also caused Squall to jump back even further. Turning around, she gave a sigh of relief in seeing who it was.

"Oh Squall, its just you!. Man, you nearly gave me a heart attack ya big lug." said Tifa with a smile, still not accustomed to the custom in the world where scares literally happen every other second. Hell, she had been scared by Jack three times making her way down to the kitchen! Straitening himself up, Squall sighed, this girl was just too eccentric for his tastes.

"Anyways, like I was saying, is everything alright?"

"Oh, yeah everything's fine. I was just peckish so I came down here to eat. Jack didn't mind, guess he just loves having guests or something. I'll be up right after I finish making a nice sandwich. Hey, you want one too?"

"No, I'm good. Just hurry and get to bed already, we have a long day ahead of us. Also make sure to watch your back, if I could startle you like this, imagine what our enemies could do." said Squall in his normally cool tone. Giving him a warm smile, she was happy that he was concerned.

"Aww, Squall, you really do care." Letting out a sigh, Squall left and made his way to bed, it was way to late to deal with that woman.
---
"Hey Namine, are you still awake?" asked Kairi, lying one of the beds in the numerous amount of guest rooms of Jack's mansion. It was decided that it was safer to have the pair together as Namine could also serve as a form of protection despite her current lack of fighting abilities. Kairi didn't mind it, while Namine was technically the Nobody born from her and Sora, she treated the blonde like a sister and Namine welcomed the notion.

"Yes, I'm finding it a bit hard to sleep, I've been thinking of a few things lately." Namine was thankful that it was dark as her friend couldn't see the bright red coloring on her normally pale face.

"Do you mind if you give me some advice. It's about Sora..."
11111221111.title: Late night, late fright

choices: In the Land of Dragons, Yuffie's falling in love with their food.
Squall and Tifa continue their training even as the women start to get fat.
111112211111.content:
The next day, Tifa smiled warmly at Namine, the fist fighter and the blond currently at empty space where Oogie Boogie's mansion used to sit.

It was perfect for training and Tifa suddenly darted forward, raining blow after blow down on Namine. The blond, for her part, managed to dodge some but eventually got hit and was sent flying.

Luckily for the blond, it didn't hurt, Tifa using barely one percent of her total strength.

"Hmmm, you have good reflexes but we need to work on your defense before focusing on offense."

"You're the expert."

Tifa just smiled again and soon got behind Namine, positing her arms in some basic blocking positions.

"Now when your opponent aims a slash towards your head, pivot this way..."

Meanwhile, Sora was sparring with Namine, Squall observing the pair.

"Kairi, pay attention!"

But it was too late and Kairi ended up on her rear due to not blocking a slash from Sora.

"Sorry about that. I saw the opening and took it."

"It's alright. I'd get mad if you held back on me," Kairi replied, blushing as she took Sora's offered hand to help her up.
111112211111.title: Training ensues!

choices: An attack is made, get into positions!
1111122111111.content:
Lea had departed from Yensid's tower by his lonesome. Due to his newfound ability to wield the keyblade, Yensid believed that he would be able to handle any upcoming situation without much backup. Lea did know most of the Organization's tricks after all. When he first entered the Land of Dragons, he was surprised that it was such an open world, it was massive compared to the worlds he had been to previously. There he met up with the great ninja Yuffie and the princess he had been assigned to protect, Alice. The three individuals had met with Mulan, a female hero that Sora had encountered on one of their previous journeys. She was informed beforehand on the current events of the situation and while she didn't really understand all of the details, she knew when she had to protect those who were being hunted by the dark. As per the Emperor's suggestions, they were allowed to stay in the imperial palace with guards on standby 24/7. The Emperor had also been informed and he could tell that the child was of great importance. Currently the trio were in one of the many rooms of the palace. Lea was reading up about the world, his curiosity getting the better of him while Yuffie was enjoying a rather hearty meal consisting of ramen and some pork cutlets. Alice was in the corner of the room reading one of the many fiction books from the grand library. It was difficult being away from her home, but this was to protect everyone and she needed to stay strong.

"Man Lea, you really need to try this, its soooo good." said Yuffie between mouthfuls of food. Staring at the girl, he only rolled his eyes are her slovenly actions. Messy girls were always so un-cute.

"Never mind that, one of us needs to be alert if anything were to come up. Anyways, keep stuffing yer face, everyone knows you can use the extra weight twiggy." said Lea. Of course he was just kidding, he simply liked messing around with new friends. Giving a humph, Yuffie returned to her meal, eating with an increased vigor.

'Man, I hope Xion and Roxas have things better than this.'
1111122111111.title: Dragon's stomach

choices: Aqua's finding it hard to do her duty with Cinderella feeding her.
111112211112.content:
Lea winced a bit at the volume and longevity of the belch coming from Yuffie, the ninja groaning afterwards but looking pleased with herself.

Alice, for her part, looked curious.

"Goodness, that was something."

Yuffie smirked and patted her taut and reddening middle. "Yep, and now all that yummy food is where it belongs!"

"We weren't supposed to be eating, but gathering materials."

Lea had decided to keep Alice in his sights at all times, Yuffie agreeing after being creeped out by the walking playing cards and Cheshire Cat. They had made good progress, gathering more than half of what they needed, the White Rabbit leading them ever onwards, until Yuffie got distracted.

The ninja's eyes were manic as she dove into the bushels of odd fruit and zany nuts that grew in Wonderland, soon devouring enough to feed two people.

"I suppose we'll have to wait until you've recovered," Lea replied, sighing as he sat down, Alice approaching Yuffie's stomach and placing her hand on it.

"Mother always said moderation is best."

Yuffie reached out a hand, some fruit offered towards the blond young woman.

"Well your mom's not here now, is she?"

Lea could do nothing but sigh as Alice swiftly started glutting herself as well.

Hopefully Roxas was doing okay wherever he was.
111112211112.title: Switch to another group

choices: She lands at the edge of Nottingham
Outside a plantation house with Parasol Heartless to greet her
112.content:
How could she have let herself fall so hard? Sure, her friends managed to save her from the darkness, but none of that could change how low Aqua felt. She walked further and further into the forest beyond the castle and it's surrounding towns, the branches of the trees covering her from the heat of the sun.

In some ways, she could forgive herself, her friends already had. But that didn't help how she felt. Even now, a small voice of doubt was whispering into her mind. "You let yourself go, the darkness held you like a toy." But what hurt about the voice was that it wasn't condescending or angery. It spoke as if Aqua had been at the best spa of her life rather than the Realm of Darkness. It sounded pleased to have been in that cold realm and having turned against her friends by command of the darkness.

Aqua tried to pay the voice no mind, walking along into the forest with no clear goal or path. This little trip was meant to get rid of that voice, she couldn't risk being around her friends if there was even a chance she might fall again. Neither the recently found Sora nor Yen Sid liked the idea, but both trusted her and knew there would be little stopping her.

After reaching an open clearing, Aqua dug into her pockets and pulled out the portal potion Yen had made for her. He had warned her that, due to the experimental nature of the mix, there was no real telling where she was going to end up. At this moment, Aqua didn't care. She could find her way home easily.

She opened the bottle and downed the potion, tasting berries with a hint of milk. Within seconds, her whole world flashed and spun.

Aqua knew she was going somewhere. Question is, just where WAS this somewhere?
112.title: Path B

choices: The Parasol Beauties welcome her, as in actually talk
They can't talk, but greet her all the same
The Beauties attack, launching Aqua far off into the plantation
1123.content:
The first thing Aqua took notice of as the transportation spell wore off was her own body. She was still human, which wouldn't seem like much of an issue but she remembered Sora telling her of the various transformations he had to go through on his journey and didn't know what to expect. All around Aqua were several bushes and trees all spread out in rows, giving the impression that she was in some kind of garden. A few of the trees and bushes had already started producing, a few trees on the right were filled with thick apples while the bushes to Aqua's left had quite a few strawberries. Many of said plants, though looking otherwise healthy, were drooping. No doubt from the need to be watered as the heat of the sun was already taking it's toll on Aqua. So much so that Aqua almost worried she was hallucinating as she saw a few basic heartless dart between the smaller bushes. Pulling out her keyblade, Aqua surveyed her general vicinity. If she really was being surrounded, she needed to make sure she had a way out. Taking a glance behind her, Aqua found herself in awe of the large house that lay before her. It was big enough to be a mansion, stone white columns standing tall from the windows that she could see.

"There's gotta be someone inside. I have to get them out before these heartless attack." With that thought in her mind, Aqua hurried towards the house with only a partial thought given to just how she was going to find the house's owners in a short time. But those thought were quickly dashed as the back doors swung open. Three figures walked out, none of them human and none of them what Aqua wanted to see. Three Parasol Beauty heartless were staring back at her, each had their parasol open and covering their floppy purple hats from the sun. Aqua had seen a few of them before in the Realm of Darkness and the bruises they gave her still hurt in her head. Aqua glanced behind her to see what her options were for doubling back, and found there were still loads of grunt heartless surveying the land. Still, she had no idea where she was and the last thing she wanted to do right now was get lost. No telling what else was out there. Aqua turned back to the trio of Parasol Beauties, taking a tighter grip on her keyblade. Once they made the first move, Aqua would figure things out from there.
1123.title: The Parasol Plantation

choices: Shorten it up (In time for Lunch)
11231.content:
Aqua awaited the Parasol's attack, prepared for whatever they had planned. The way they just stood on the steps to the mansion could only be of malice and suffering.

"My, my, she is quite forward." At first, Aqua was silent. She wasn't sure if what she had heard was from her own imagination or if the heartless in the center really did talk. It had looked to the others around her and everything, but it was impossible. Heartless (at least of this variety) couldn't talk, especially not in such a stuffy and high class way. The one to her left giggled, as is there was an actual laughing sound accompanied by a waving of her hand.

"Hello there dearie. That sure is a might big key yer carrying there." This one had the inflection of a Southern Belle, still with a pompus undertone but the Southern side did make her sound at least a but more friendly.

"It's a keyblade sister." The Beauty on the right spoke with a heavy accent bordering on Russian. This one had never looked away from her. "This is clearly one of those commoner warriors. Or at least someone imitating them."

Although blushing from that snide comment, Aqua was dumbfounded. She wasn't imagining it and if it was ventriloquism, then it was a top notch effort. The fact that these were in fact heartless kept her guard up, but the oddity of talking heartless was piping her curiosity.

"Oh just look at the poor thing, she's gotta be near death in this heat." The Parasol Beauty on the left stepped closer to Aqua, showing none of the fear or disdain the keyblade wielder had often seen on heartless of all kinds. "Would you like to come inside?"

The Heartless in the middle pulled her back by her parasol. "Sister, we mustn't be undignified. She doesn't even know who we are." With that, all three heartless gave a bow to Aqua.

"My name is Velvet." The center Beauty spoke.

"My name is Satin." The Beauty on the left giggled again as she waved.

With a 'humpf' the third said, "And I am Lace. Now what is your name?"

"My name's Aqua." Her guard was still up, but the (semi)polite nature of these Beauties was rather calming compared to other heartless. Speaking of which. "Are you three..."

"Charming? Beautiful? Stand out amongst those lowlife grunts out there? Thanks fer noticing." Satin twirled about, Lace seemingly snorting at the display.

"Satin dear, I think the poor girl is confused why we are not more like..." Velvet pointed her hand to the fields, "...we would love to awsner that question. But would you like to come inside? It is terribly hot out and our Parasols only do so much."

Aqua had to admit, the heat was getting worse already. Maybe it was just seeing them in thier Parasols, but Aqua couldn't help but feel jealous. Then again, she didn't think heartless could feel heat. For now, she would accept thier offer, but be on alert.

"Wonderful." Velvet turned towards the door of the mansion, her sisters following suit and walking. Aqua put her keyblade away as she followed behind. She didn't want to arouse too much distrust. They walked up the marble staircase through the double doors and past thick purple curtains. Aqua found herself in luxury she was used to seeing in castles. High quality marble flooring and walls and blue and purple rugs lining the area. The three Parasol Beauties walked over to a group of pristine chairs by a massive fireplace. Above the mantel was a massive picture of what Aqua could only assume was the three of them.

"Come, come dear." Velvet snapped her fingers and two grunt heartless carried in a fourth chair and rushed outside as soon as it was done.

No better option on hand, Aqua walked to the chair and sat down. She could feel the cushions molding to her form, creating a hightened level of comfort.

"Now listen dearie, I realize you must be a busy girl. Plus, it's about our mealtime. So if you want us to give a short version of the story, I can understand. But we feel you might be fasinated by how we came to be the height of Heartless we are."
11231.title: A...Warm Welcome?

choices: Lunch is uneventful, though mighty delicious
As Aqua eats, she softens up...both physically and mentally to the Beauties
112311.content:
Despite the kind nature of the trio and the elegant surroundings, they were still Heartless. Which meant Aqua still had no intention of fully trusting them. (Although she didn't want to admit that she was getting quite peckish herself.) "I think I'd prefer the short version."

Velvet nodded. "I suppose we'll survive the disappointment. Would one of you like to tell her then? You know how much I like to ramble."

Satin raised her hand before Lace shot her what Aqua could only assume was a glare. "You're no better sister, and you known it."

"Ah darn." Satin put her hand down, her floppy hat drooping.

Lace turned back to Aqua. "Well, if little miss impatient wants it quick, then here. When we were first created, those fools Xeanort and his silly organization thought they controlled us. Quite frankly, my sister and I thought they were a bunch of depressing children going on about 'darkness of the heart's and how depressing life is. My sisters and I simply had enough of it. So first chance we got, we vanished to this world. As for those lowlife grunts we you saw out there in the fields, that's exactly what they are. Nothing more than annoying little savages that my sisters and I were gracious enough to have working in our fields." Lace pulled our a small fan from a pocket and flapped it. "After all, we certainly don't want these clothes ruined with working that all that dirt."

Velvet nodded. "Of course not sister, no need to make things more difficult for ourselves. As you can imagine, you're the first human we've seen in person since we moved to this dimension."

"And what a cutie to be our first." Satin giggled as she waved her gloves fingers at Aqua, prompting a small giggle from the keyblade user. Velvet and Lace both tapped Satin with thier Parasols. "Well look at her.

"Satin, there is no need to be rude. You shouldn't just say things like that to someone with truly getting to know them." A small bell coming from the next room over took Velvet's attention, as well as the rest of her sisters. "And I suppose the quickest way to someone's heart is through their stomach. Miss Aqua, you simply must join us for a meal. Our servants may be dim, but they certainly know how to cook."

"Hold it sister." Lace steeped forward towards Aqua, her heartless eyes studying Aqua's body. "If she is going to find with us, she certainly cannot do so in her current state. I mean look at her, all of that dirt on her body. I swear it's a wonder why I allowed her in the house." Lace's words prompted Aqua to glance at herself. She did get some dirt on her from the fields, though it didn't look like that much.

"Aw come on sis." Satin hugged Lace tightly. "She's new here and the poor thing is probably starving. Ah now how long her little baths take. Don't be such a prude and let her dine with us."

Lace's gaze switched between Aqua and the pleading eyes of her sister.

"Dear sister." Velvet interrupted Lace's thoughts. "At least let Miss Aqua eat first. Then we can give her a proper grooming.

Lace sighed. "Fine, but when you're complaining about..."

Lace didn't even have time to finished her statement before Satin rushed to Aqua, grabbed her by the hand and pulled her along. "Come on then cute stuff. Time to show you how a heartless of class dines." The excited southern heartless pulled Aqua into a dining hall, it"s extravagance rivaling that of the living room. In the center was a table streching out all across the large space, looking more like it would seat 100 rather than 3. Candles and portirats of her hosts hung from every wall. As for the spread on the table, it was a grand feast the likes of which Aqua had rarely ever seen. Veggies and fruits were abound, no doubt picked from the gardens outside while large roasted birds and assorted meats occupied the center. As for seating however, there were only three chairs present.

"Oh goodness, I am so sorry Aqua." Satin clasped her mouthless face. We should have reminded those dolts to prepare another chair. Don't worry, ah can fix this." With a snap of her fingers, a grunt heartless rushed into the room. Satin's chested puffed up as her southern belle voice became soured by a deep anger. "Listen shorty, I'm gonna forget the stupidity of yah'll to not get a chair for our guest. For now though, you get to be Aqua's seat. Now get going." The small heartless wasted no time in sitting up to the table, propping itself up. "There now, why don't you sit your little bottom down and we can begin?
112311.title: Short, Sweet, and now let's eat

choices: Streams of darkness begin flowing into her mouth
A member of O 13 comes to gloat
Her body was absorbing the heartless!
113.content:
Aqua was done.

She couldn't fight anymore.

How long had been in this terrible, dark place with no sign of ever getting out?

Her friends were nowhere to be found, did she even have any friends? The darkness kept clouding her mind, it was becoming so difficult to think positive thoughts. Aqua kept wandering, the yellow eyes of the heartless stayed away, but at a close distance. Even they could tell that her strength was failing. She was all alone, there was no one to save her from the Realm of Darkness.

Aqua fell onto the construct of floor, her keyblade falling without a word. "I can't escape it. I'm trapped here, in the darkness." Those words, those two sentences that were so filled with dispair. They acted almost as a key, opening the doors to Aqua's heart and mind and the darkness was all too happy to invite itself in. What little light was left vanished as the heartless pounced on her.

Aqua didn't care. She had already lost. Which is why she was surprised to find that they weren't attacking her. Rather, they were holding her down. Her head was given a few of the world while the rest of her was covered in the dark mass of heartless. Just what was going on?
113.title: Oh Dear Darkness

12.content: Pick your path for Kairi.
12.title: Kairi

choices: There was Roxas, who was ecstatic to finally find her!
There was Olette, who didn't know Xion was there.
Xion was contemplating getting more ice cream this time.
135.content: Xion sat alone on top of the clock tower, nibbling on some ice cream. The girl was a runaway, bearing the Organizations clothes only because...well, those were her only articles of clothing. She used whatever munny she had to feed herself, not knowing the concept of fashion or the basic understanding of a different wardrobe, so Xion just sat up there and ate. The bars seemed to double each day, one, two, four...this time, Xion had went through around sixteen in one sitting. There was indefinitely a little bit of pudge going on with her. She sat alone, depressed, finishing off her last lick when she turned around, sighing a bit.
135.title: The Longest Day

15.title: Other

info.brief_description: An interactive for the Kingdom Hearts series, write about your favorite girls getting fat.
info.description:
As stated, this is a general female weight gain for the Kingdom Hearts series

Rules:
No gains in an instant (ie 500 pounds in one scene)
No slob
No male weight gain
No death, or obsessive gore
Yuri is fine, no going towards sex however
Please make decent submissions, anything lacking in quality will be deleted.
